title.narrative: 3.3 CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING

description.narrative: By 2025, Kosovo institutions have strengthened capacities to generate and use quality disaggregated data to monitor, evaluate and report on the situation of children, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, all girls and boys, particularly the most marginalized, benefit from integrated social and child protection services for the sustainable and equitable realization of their rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, Kosovo institutions have strengthened capacities to generate and use quality disaggregated data to monitor, evaluate andreport on the situation of children

description.narrative: National capacities on evaluation were strengthened through the nationally led youth-accompanied evaluation of the Human Capital Pillar of the National Development Strategy (2016-2021). Following a Rapid Integrated Assessment, which identified gaps regarding data availability for and policy alignment with the 2030 SDG Agenda, national capacities on data system strengthening, data collection and data analysis were further enhanced through the consolidation of, and reporting on, child-related indicators across key relevant areas. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022
